body:
Hi Cramer,


Radiance should parse materials.rad (only) if you include it into your  
scene. I guess you are referring to the file materials.rad from the  
distribution. If you include it, you should also have the required cal- 
files on your syste
. So just make sure that your RAYPATH is set correctly for your  
installation!


Besides that, including default material files can be tricky. Radiance  
does not complain about defining a modifier using the same name  
twice... you may end up with unexpected results if some default  
material definition overwrites what you wanted to use. Just take care!


Cheers, Lars.




Dipl.-Ing. Architect Lars O. Grobe
___
<sup>Automatically generated content from [radiance mailing-list](https://radiance-online.org/pipermail/radiance-general/2010-June/007016.html).</sup>
